intro: Bulbostylis striatella, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale green flowers. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in many parts of its range.
